description: A container is a fixed width element that wraps your site's content. It remains a constant size and uses margin to center. Containers are the simplest way to center page content inside a grid.

A grid does not necessarily need to specify rows. If you include columns as direct child of ui grid content will automatically flow to the next row when all the grid columns are taken in the current row.

title: Clearing Rows
description: Adding row wrappers allow you to manually specify you want a new row to begin.

title: Specifying Row Width
description: Specifying a grid column count will divide columns into rows of predetermined column count. Additional columns will automatically flow to the next row.
